Description: Corroded fragment of a copper alloy small buckle, comprising two broken parts attached by corrosion : the side of a flat frame in the form of an eight-shaped double loop (one loop of "pelta" type, with ends curling inward, welded on top of an oval or possibly D-shaped one), and a short central prong, with a pointing and curved tip and a thicker end grasping one of the loops in the centre of the frame. On the back of the frame fragment are welded two short rectangular strips of metal, pierced by a small round hole (one with the top partly broken and missing), which were certainly used for fastening another part of the fitting.
Curator's comments: See also London, BM, EA 23886, a very similar fragment, which is very probably part of the same object. See also other possible buckles or part of buckles : London, BM, EA 23870, 23871, 23872. Similar pierced strip of metal, possibly for swivel, on 23871. Two other copper alloy buckles from Tell Dafana, of Roman or Byzantine type, are in Cairo, EM, JE 27370 a & b.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 80 § 80) (?)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.79, p.185, pl.27)
